['Manufacturing Engineer ', 'Amery, WI 54001 ', 'SMC Ltd.', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0AF17CXmSDu7ztK3jBou-loQGOEo5sb5tXWjzVOTWlCGobfa-YoIsYyiIzf2XjRKTuONs-uO8LbJIVUurWOokx5--JtU520h2iPOu95XrOcTGKORDHWVErAnE0_QXcphrW0FAAjvrA4hZ1l5zbdTCREmNgUPyD3v7GHiPjEEVstEzZwwT8gO-FHeQHNrTkdM5UFJ6bn1Mu54BDRLn3Au5zg5Wbq3l50ah0F0vkPjhwzBKrHTYocbx8qqZu3w3kMnEjTpS2MRq_CxNb6aTbOCWpVMI37BrZsAlHgNikFiMuPuQnsDCTQFXExBdJtiYO9xFrQmr8irGkFXmK-jEY9Ko357H9z4OvMruxcchtGTs4UzODZJVezr26EfKbC50Vnttj5nineyvEh4g5GeqV7hu4bA2CJDKYlfBCHTUFRxuXR20glQvKTMy0h&vjs=3&p=1&sk=&fvj=1', 'As a manufacturer of Diagnostic, Drug Delivery and Medical Devices our Manufacturing Engineers are responsible for manufacturing processes of products designed to improve and save lives. Specific responsibilities include creation of robust processes and identification and correction of waste in existing processes. Applicant must be able to prioritize and manage multiple projects and utilize available resources to deliver to the need of the customer. Other responsibilities include the generation of clear technical documentation that are appropriate for the end user. Requirements include a BS in Engineering or equivalent experience and technical skills in manufacturing processes i.e. tooling, robotics and all value added operations and methods including product flow, layout and assembly and production equipment. Previous experience in statistics or robotics is preferred but not required. Strong interpersonal, analytical, communication skills and the ability to work as a strong team player are critical to the success of this position. Job Type: Full-time Experience: Manufacturing Engineering: 1 year (Preferred)', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black chevron-right" role="img"><g><path d="M7.5,4.5L6.44,5.56,9.88,9,6.44,12.44,7.5,13.5,12,9Z"></path></g></svg></div></div></div></div></a></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p>As a manufacturer of Diagnostic, Drug Delivery and Medical Devices our Manufacturing Engineers are responsible for manufacturing processes of products designed to improve and save lives. Specific responsibilities include creation of robust processes and identification and correction of waste in existing processes. Applicant must be able to prioritize and manage multiple projects and utilize available resources to deliver to the need of the customer. Other responsibilities include the generation of clear technical documentation that are appropriate for the end user.</p><p>Requirements include a BS in Engineering or equivalent experience and technical skills in manufacturing processes i.e. tooling, robotics and all value added operations and methods including product flow, layout and assembly and production equipment. Previous experience in statistics or robotics is preferred but not required. Strong interpersonal, analytical, communication skills and the ability to work as a strong team player are critical to the success of this position.</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>Manufacturing Engineering: 1 year (Preferred)</li></ul></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">2 days ['Robotics CNC Machine Engineer ', 'Schaumburg, IL 60173 ', 'Yamazen, Inc', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0BPIJ68mJTjJSNsYid0b1fWApXU33ypYHlwLg5R8T1GHCQuvFCYVAiPTzud0Szs7zp__LaqOGAMJAx7mp7b0LlSCqgdiP8FW0abcw1nrGDZmFoLitzfzXibsKGy6AMeugAo27qAeGOUfvmbL_c5ANnCXSB_kq7iR_fBGn7wVTVyZXUp9c8MDMYfEx2zU0hisVsdrISrX2E8ZcQHbxL5m0N5AOhAo8duMK38W0jKqO70e3lB8RIrnVIm5WfWpJUkqdDfe-R5--PhPsbcBPm5Zd62b8Q0te0Ri1VkOyetlt2vVnMXylBfvNvWgapQKdJBbUwyr7av11KWut2QqjdQNPjCsA-iHJb2zwzSX7XzEpwQoNqmd8I2KzggVBXvRuYYeK9XxAy6TO9KtDaK5bVpzaXFZM64PfLWtEpev57p7hwFpry8tx_-hbfp7TKx4puTwSc=&vjs=3&p=2&sk=&fvj=1', "Company Profile:  Yamazen Inc. is an importer and distributor of quality CNC manufacturing machinery, including machine tools and injection molding machines. We service manufacturers in the automotive, aerospace, construction equipment, medical, and I.T. industries. We have 13 U.S. offices serving markets throughout the country and have experienced significant growth through territory and market expansion. We are building a new automation group to better serve our customers. Opportunity:  Yamazen has an immediate opening for a  Robotics CNC   (Automation) Engineer  to join our team. As an automation engineer you will be responsible for robot programming, project management, CAD drawings and renderings of proposed cells. The chosen candidate with will enjoy working from a state-of-the-art technical facility in  Schaumburg, IL . Our main focus will to automate our CNC Brother and/or CNC Takisawa lathes. Additional responsibilities include assisting with the redesign of our automation machine tending cell called our Flex loader and setting up suppliers. Skills and Qualifications:  The preferred candidate will possess a strong machining background that includes: 3 years of experience in CNC machine tending automation, both in turning and milling 3 years of robot programing experience, including robotic end of arm tooling design Project Management experience Solid organization and prioritization skills A strong work ethic and problem-solving skills The ability to work under pressure with strict deadlines Strong verbal and written skills A valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required Compensation and Benefits:  In return for quality results, Yamazen Inc. provides a competitive compensation package including salary and semi-annual bonus opportunities. Employee benefits include  company paid  medical, dental, vision, short- & long-term disability and life insurance within the first 90 days, 401K with company match, holiday shut-down between Christmas and New Year’s Day, and more! No phone calls please. Yamazen is an equal opportunity employment company. All applicants are considered regardless of age, race, sex, color, national origin, religion, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other protected status. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year Experience: automation programming: 3 years (Required) License: Driver's License (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle icl-u-xs-mb--md"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary icl-u-xs-mb--md"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">Yamazen, Inc</div><div class="icl-u-lg-block icl-u-xs-hide icl-u-lg-mr--sm"><div class="icl-Ratings class="jobsearch-JobMetadataHeader icl-u-xs-mb--md"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataHeader-item icl-u-textColor--secondary">$70,000 - $90,000 a year</div></div><div class="jobsearch-CompanyReview icl-u-lg-hide"><a class="icl-NavigableContainer-linkWrapper" href="https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Yamazen,-Inc/reviews?campaignid=mobvjcmp&amp;cmpratingc=mobviewjob&amp;from=mobviewjob&amp;tk=1comappo1a20t800&amp;fromjk=0b284c6128c5c120&amp;jt=Robotics+CNC+Machine+Engineer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderBottom icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderTop"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-innerContainer"><h4 class="jobsearch-CompanyReview--heading">Yamazen, Inc</h4><div class="icl-Ratings icl-Ratings--gold icl-Ratings--md" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating"><meta content="3.0" itemprop="ratingValue"><meta content="2" itemprop="ratingCount"><div aria-label="3 out of 5" class="icl-Ratings-starsCountWrapper" tabindex="0"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsWrapper"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsUnfilled"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsFilled" style="width: 57.0px;"></div></div></div><div aria-hidden="true" class="icl-Ratings-count">2 reviews</div></div><div aria-hidden="true" class="icl-Ratings-description">Read what people are saying about working here.</div></meta></meta></div><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black chevron-right" role="img"><g><path d="M7.5,4.5L6.44,5.56,9.88,9,6.44,12.44,7.5,13.5,12,9Z"></path></g></svg></div></div></div></div></a></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><b>Company Profile: </b></p><p>Yamazen Inc. is an importer and distributor of quality CNC manufacturing machinery, including machine tools and injection molding machines. We service manufacturers in the automotive, aerospace, construction equipment, medical, and I.T. industries. We have 13 U.S. offices serving markets throughout the country and have experienced significant growth through territory and market expansion. We are building a new automation group to better serve our customers.</p><p><b>Opportunity: </b></p><p>Yamazen has an immediate opening for a <b>Robotics CNC</b> <b>(Automation) Engineer</b> to join our team. As an automation engineer you will be responsible for robot programming, project management, CAD drawings and renderings of proposed cells. The chosen candidate with will enjoy working from a state-of-the-art technical facility in <b>Schaumburg, IL</b>. Our main focus will to automate our CNC Brother and/or CNC Takisawa lathes. Additional responsibilities include assisting with the redesign of our automation machine tending cell called our Flex loader and setting up suppliers.</p><p><b>Skills and Qualifications: </b></p><p>The preferred candidate will possess a strong machining background that includes:</p><ul><li>3 years of experience in CNC machine tending automation, both in turning and milling</li><li>3 years of robot programing experience, including robotic end of arm tooling design</li><li>Project Management experience</li><li>Solid organization and prioritization skills</li><li>A strong work ethic and problem-solving skills</li><li>The ability to work under pressure with strict deadlines</li><li>Strong verbal and written skills</li><li>A valid driver’s license and reliable transportation is required</li></ul><p><b>Compensation and Benefits: </b></p><p>In return for quality results, Yamazen Inc. provides a competitive compensation package including salary and semi-annual bonus opportunities. Employee benefits include <b>company paid</b> medical, dental, vision, short- &amp; long-term disability and life insurance within the first 90 days, 401K with company match, holiday shut-down between Christmas and New Year’s Day, and more!</p><p>No phone calls please.</p><p><i>Yamazen is an equal opportunity employment company. All applicants are considered regardless of age, race, sex, color, national origin, religion, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other protected status.</i></p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Salary: $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 /year</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>automation programming: 3 years (Required)</li></ul><p>License:</p><ul><li>Driver's License (Required)</li></ul><p>Work authorization:</p><ul><li>United States (Required)</li></ul></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">30+ days ['Project Manager, Robotics & Automation ', 'Greensboro, NC ', 'ABCO Automation Inc.', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0ByWq4Q7BKU9eeRNUNgTI2T-ZRDyXNLUCPKPaHHse5OANMiUPqVVyRhHJif6vP-Kr7c5AnltxNjmbQWkcmGr8-XKJKp06Gz8b3k6l3JNuZOuTsWU90ev1Kt3QO8u40EZ32pKui-TQbFziDLeRGrO2dUdLlvWW8P3xLyyklKQnJrsKkeqrCDZ-vPrNVHiPjNGBgHjO8g4CriWF-WKeeNSYvsBgCx4Ys9FtOWIokTh7hks-VQaGExUi-o3sQk5duGLeWEpdD41q_m7oXlhXSrGEL-i43X5gY8mtKt-mjZnUiVLlOQfBbw3VKplLXfE7cNzu4xvFcCr2lylmg_jAp4h8knwJXnbw4O3961riHD7lyxYsXR_ay8Qz_mn24Al-4IYGnN-3JowfSdkhiI5acYFcc_nhCgtQhOkMmsKuoWtSpiCGqRukzhPrQA3zYqJGD3KU4=&vjs=3&p=3&sk=&fvj=1', "Job Summary:  Manage the project plans, schedules and coordination for multiple or simultaneous projects to assure on time delivery within quality and cost objectives. Major Accountabilities:  Manages multiple complex projects while assuring the on-time completion within cost and quality objectives. Project management measures will include: Cost margin actual performance versus budget. Customer satisfaction through schedule on-time completion and meeting customer expectations and success criteria while maintaining a positive professional relationship. Manages scope changes or project/business changes with all vendors, customers and ABCO. Leads with the project negotiations of additional funds or resolutions of project issues. Meets or exceeds budget margins by effectively planning and executing assigned project work and supervising the work of team members to effectively plan and execute their project work. Develops and administers project(s) schedules based on each project’s introduction, production process, outside contractors, equipment availability and delivery date. Interfaces directly and effectively with other departments at ABCO to engineer, manufacture, and coordinate projects. Leads Project Team by providing the overall direction, coordination and motivation to ensure successful execution of projects. Assists in developing and delivering presentations both within the project team and to customers. Maintains frequent communication with vendors, customers and contractors and solicits new business when possible. Effectively uses all ABCO systems and procedures, including Syteline, to manage work in an accurate and timely manner. If assigned, efficiently manages & coaches one or more department resources to achieve excellent program/system results. Lead company-wide system improvement efforts as needed Approachable, flexible and a strong team player. Dependable attendance. Working Conditions:  Working environment is generally favorable with adequate lighting and temperature. There are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, smells, etc. Some travel required. Minimum Education Required:  Bachelor Degree in engineering or equivalent experience. Minimum Years of Experience Required:  Eight (8) years engineering or engineering project management experience. Key Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:  Demonstrated knowledge of the Project Management Skills & Techniques included in the Project Managers Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK) Experience leading, mentoring, and coaching project teams Technical Functional Knowledge Excellent communication skills at all levels of the organization, both internally and externally Ability to lead by influencing Ability to hold team members accountable Demonstrated ability to execute projects from start to finish Demonstrated ability to solve problems Effective Negotiating Skills Effective Time Management Overall understanding of business issues-profit margins Demonstrated computer skills – Word, Excel, Powerpoint, MS project Understand standard Project Performance measures Experience managing project risks and developing risk mitigation plans Job Type: Full-time Experience: project management: 8 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) License: Project Management Professional (PMP) (Preferred)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

icl-u-lg-mt--md"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-innerContent icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-offset2 icl-u-lg-span10"><div class="icl-Grid"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-jobDisplay icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Project Manager, Robotics &amp; Automation</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">ABCO Automation Inc.</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Greensboro, NC</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><b>Job Summary: </b></p><p>Manage the project plans, schedules and coordination for multiple or simultaneous projects to assure on time delivery within quality and cost objectives.</p><p><b>Major Accountabilities: </b></p><ul><li>Manages multiple complex projects while assuring the on-time completion within cost and quality objectives.</li><li>Project management measures will include:</li><li>Cost margin actual performance versus budget.</li><li>Customer satisfaction through schedule on-time completion and meeting customer expectations and success criteria while maintaining a positive professional relationship.</li><li>Manages scope changes or project/business changes with all vendors, customers and ABCO. Leads with the project negotiations of additional funds or resolutions of project issues.</li><li>Meets or exceeds budget margins by effectively planning and executing assigned project work and supervising the work of team members to effectively plan and execute their project work.</li><li>Develops and administers project(s) schedules based on each project’s introduction, production process, outside contractors, equipment availability and delivery date.</li><li>Interfaces directly and effectively with other departments at ABCO to engineer, manufacture, and coordinate projects.</li><li>Leads Project Team by providing the overall direction, coordination and motivation to ensure successful execution of projects.</li><li>Assists in developing and delivering presentations both within the project team and to customers.</li><li>Maintains frequent communication with vendors, customers and contractors and solicits new business when possible.</li><li>Effectively uses all ABCO systems and procedures, including Syteline, to manage work in an accurate and timely manner.</li><li>If assigned, efficiently manages &amp; coaches one or more department resources to achieve excellent program/system results.</li><li>Lead company-wide system improvement efforts as needed</li><li>Approachable, flexible and a strong team player.</li><li>Dependable attendance.</li></ul><p><b>Working Conditions: </b></p><p>Working environment is generally favorable with adequate lighting and temperature. There are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, smells, etc. Some travel required.</p><p><b>Minimum Education Required: </b></p><p>Bachelor Degree in engineering or equivalent experience.</p><p><b>Minimum Years of Experience Required: </b></p><p>Eight (8) years engineering or engineering project management experience.</p><p><b>Key Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required: </b></p><ul><li>Demonstrated knowledge of the Project Management Skills &amp; Techniques included in the Project Managers Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK)</li><li>Experience leading, mentoring, and coaching project teams</li><li>Technical Functional Knowledge</li><li>Excellent communication skills at all levels of the organization, both internally and externally</li><li>Ability to lead by influencing</li><li>Ability to hold team members accountable</li><li>Demonstrated ability to execute projects from start to finish</li><li>Demonstrated ability to solve problems</li><li>Effective Negotiating Skills</li><li>Effective Time Management</li><li>Overall understanding of business issues-profit margins</li><li>Demonstrated computer skills – Word, Excel, Powerpoint, MS project</li><li>Understand standard Project Performance measures</li><li>Experience managing project risks and developing risk mitigation plans</li></ul><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>project management: 8 years (Preferred)</li></ul><p>Education:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's (Preferred)</li></ul><p>License:</p><ul><li>Project Management Professional (PMP) (Preferred)</li></ul></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">13 days ago<span class="icl-u-lg-inline icl-u-xs-hide" d="M7.5,4.5L6.44,5.56,9.88,9,6.44,12.44,7.5,13.5,12,9Z"></path></g></svg></div></div></div></div></a></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><p><b>REQUIRED</b><b> EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION: (i.e. degree, years of experience, etc.)</b></p><br/>
<ul>
<li><b>Degree minimum:
</b><ul><li>Minimum Education of BSME or Equivalent</li>
</ul></li><li><b>Experience level:
</b><ul><li>4 to 7 years in Product Development</li><br/>
</ul>
</li>
</ul><br/>
<p><b>SPECIALIZED TRAINING OR SKILLS REQUIRED:</b></p>
<p>
Exposure to project management</p>
<p>
Strength in engineering fundamentals Geometric dimensioning</p>
<p>
Analytical approach to problems Exposure to finite element analysis</p>
<p>
Basic personal computer skills Design of Experiments (Taguchi)</p>
<p>
Electromechanical product design Team environment</p>
<p>
Plastic part design Subsystem requirements developed from system</p>
<p>
UL approved products Sensor and motor system integration</p>
<p>
Test development and results analysis</p><br/>
<p><b>
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION</b><b>: (i.e. MBA, certifications, etc.)</b></p><br/>
<p>
3D CAD (Creo preferred)</p>
<p>
Experience with robotics or automated equipment</p></div> <div><p><b>POSITION SUMMARY: (Summary description of the primary duties and objectives)</b></p><br/>
<p>
Design and development of robotic and electromechanical consumer floor care appliances<b>.</b></p><br/>
<p><b>
POSITION PROFILE (Major duties, accountabilities, and responsibilities)<br/>
</b></p><br/>
<ul><li>Act as technical team leader on small projects or portions of larger projects.</li>
<li>Participate in initial product conception and feasibility studies.</li>
<li>Create preliminary mechanical layouts of products.</li>
<li>Participate in the development of comprehensive test plans.</li>
<li>Analyze test results and understand product performance.</li>
<li>Assure that all CAD data is correct and complete for projects.</li>
<li>Specify and select purchased components.</li>
<li>Set clear and thorough part and material specifications for the product.</li>
<li>Work with Manager to plan activities, schedule tasks, and estimate resources.</li>
<li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li><br/>
</ul>
<br/>
<p><b>ENVIRONMENT:
</b></p><p>Cross functional, collocated team setting.</p>
<ul>
<li>Interaction with CAD, supplier(s) or manufacturing locations, US project teams</li>
<li>Fast paced, fact based decision making organization</li>
<li>Concept to production involvement in projects</li>
<li>Limited travel</li><br/>
</ul>
<br/>
<p><b>REQUIRED</b><b> CORE COMPETENCIES for PROFESSIONAL/TECHNICAL JOB FAMILY:</b></p>
<p>
Global strategic thinking and implementation</p>
<p>
Continuous improvement</p>
<p>
Oral and written communication with impact</p>
<p>
Manage/contribute to multiple dynamic priorities</p>
<p>
Professional expertise</p>
<p>
Actively seek and share information</p>
<p>
Interpersonal/collaborative skills</p>
<p>
Initiative</p></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span class="icl-u-textColor--success">BISSELL</span> - 12 days ago<span ['Automation Engineer ', 'Rome, GA 30165 ', 'Neaton Rome, Inc.', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0AhHp0BVZFhdEyETONEivwTnwfWAh_wZebPmqFZ2_IvVI3uq_h8JND9ntDzhzNMrNk1XEPjcRm9w6-__D_g9j_bL8hFhncneVV-3Z2wjWU4pK0YH29hOFFslBI1GfbALYMl7Brp1AK44WCS-G26vqucidvSEpNLXmaCNErTF3la6Pkm6G_Dv7alHMww4izzRR8EoF_HqhQqREBMaGNQvXFU-nT9pxYW8GvRfQUoEMDmZOhuDlx1yTbQJFBkr3t3NbKQ3PziH5RsL4lxR1YvBburvnTdm6uEJ4x4nxnzHiFcn2Lwvk_ffMtiWoP0wuz1Q5SBHRcwjmwLuuYxyJyeXjKmEvIHJym_D2BlMA8VlPwKL8HMK1jL86li0wyV8YYOEU1FtGeE3pSMSbv7OKnsEKueuDoc48sz_QZQ_4ZTT5uUKQ==&vjs=3&p=5&sk=&fvj=1', 'AUTOMATION ENGINEER IMMEDIATE OPPORTUNITY FOR AUTOMATION ENGINEER WITH TIER ONE AUTOMOTIVE SUPPLIER EXCELLENT BENEFITS PACKAGE Primary Role in the Organization:  Ensure mass production equipment is meeting both NRI and customer SQCD requirments. Ensure machinery and equipment is capable of producing quality product safely and efficiently. Secondary emphasis is placed on new model support Reports To:  Engineering Manager Supervises:  N/A Responsibilities:  Provide technical support to production and maintenance in trouble shooting and maintaining automated procesess. Create, Control and Modify programs for various control systems (examples include CNC, PLC/HMI, etc.) Design, quote, and create equipment/fixtures to aid production processes (structure, process, wiring, sensors). Modify current equipment/fixtures to update process requirements. Assist with Kaizen activities and Engineering projects. New Model Support:  Utilize the PDCA cycle in Project managing equipment suppliers to meet the customers new model expectations and NAPM equipment specifications. Utilize the SQCD format when procuring equipment and meet internal expectations regarding process design and capital investment. Evaluate part drawings and sketches to understand product design and specification in developing manufacturing equipment. Provide training for all associates on new equipment operations Utilize the PDCA cycle when installing & debuging new equipment. Qualifications:  Experience 1) Experience with complex mechanical designs and various controls for automated machine operations 2) Familiar with QMS practices and procedures 3) Support any certifications Neaton maintains 4) Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office, PLC/MMI, 3D software (Solidworks preferred), Robotics programming (6-axis, ABB, Motoman, Allen-Bradley, Mitsubishi), and basic communications programs 5) Experience in fabrication, CNC, 3D printing, electrical panels is a plus. Education 1) Bachelors Degree or equivalent - 10 year experience developing manufacturing assembly equipment; Mechanical Engineering preferred. Salary DOE EOE/m/f Job Type: Full-time edit jobclose jobview cost & performancefind candidates for this job Views:   1,074 Candidates:   167 Status:   Open – pause Created:   Apr 21 2017View public job page Promote this job for more candidates: inShare Products – Resources – FAQ – Blog Job Type: Full-time', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

icl-u-lg-mt--md"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-innerContent icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-offset2 icl-u-lg-span10"><div class="icl-Grid"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-jobDisplay icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Automation Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">Neaton Rome, Inc.</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Rome, GA 30165</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p><b>AUTOMATION ENGINEER</b></p><p><b>IMMEDIATE OPPORTUNITY FOR AUTOMATION ENGINEER WITH TIER ONE AUTOMOTIVE SUPPLIER</b></p><p><b>EXCELLENT BENEFITS PACKAGE</b></p><p><b>Primary Role in the Organization: </b></p><p>Ensure mass production equipment is meeting both NRI and customer SQCD requirments. Ensure machinery and equipment is capable of producing quality product safely and efficiently. Secondary emphasis is placed on new model support</p><p><b>Reports To: </b></p><p>Engineering Manager</p><p><b>Supervises: </b></p><p>N/A</p><p><b>Responsibilities: </b></p><ul><li>Provide technical support to production and maintenance in trouble shooting and maintaining automated procesess.</li><li>Create, Control and Modify programs for various control systems (examples include CNC, PLC/HMI, etc.)</li><li>Design, quote, and create equipment/fixtures to aid production processes (structure, process, wiring, sensors).</li><li>Modify current equipment/fixtures to update process requirements.</li><li>Assist with Kaizen activities and Engineering projects.</li><li><b>New Model Support: </b></li><li>Utilize the PDCA cycle in Project managing equipment suppliers to meet the customers new model expectations and NAPM equipment specifications.</li><li>Utilize the SQCD format when procuring equipment and meet internal expectations regarding process design and capital investment.</li><li>Evaluate part drawings and sketches to understand product design and specification in developing manufacturing equipment.</li><li>Provide training for all associates on new equipment operations</li><li>Utilize the PDCA cycle when installing &amp; debuging new equipment.</li></ul><p><b>Qualifications: </b></p><ul><li><b>Experience</b></li></ul><p>1) Experience with complex mechanical designs and various controls for automated machine operations</p><p>2) Familiar with QMS practices and procedures</p><p>3) Support any certifications Neaton maintains</p><p>4) Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office, PLC/MMI, 3D software (Solidworks preferred), Robotics programming (6-axis, ABB, Motoman, Allen-Bradley, Mitsubishi), and basic communications programs</p><p>5) Experience in fabrication, CNC, 3D printing, electrical panels is a plus.</p><ul><li><b>Education</b></li></ul><p>1) Bachelors Degree or equivalent - 10 year experience developing manufacturing assembly equipment; Mechanical Engineering preferred.</p><p>Salary DOE</p><p>EOE/m/f</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>edit jobclose jobview cost &amp; performancefind candidates for this job<b>Views: </b> 1,074<b>Candidates: </b> 167<b>Status: </b> Open – pause<b>Created: </b> Apr 21 2017View public job page</p><p>Promote this job for more candidates:</p><p>inShare</p><p>Products – Resources – FAQ – Blog</p><p>Job Type: Full-time</p></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">30+ days ago<span class="icl-u-lg-inline !@#$%^&*()_+

['Robotics Engineer ', 'Boulder, CO 80301 ', 'Canvas Technology', 'https://indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=be5ca60530570b2e&fccid=91531f080b85f54c&vjs=3', 'We have an immediate opening for an excellent Robotics engineer with hands-on experience. In this role you will work with a small team of sales representatives, service agents, electrical, mechanical, software and robotics engineers in a fast-moving environment where you will have direct impact on our success. You will be resolving a wide range of customer-facing challenges, including best-in-class customer use and deployment as well as in-field process improvements. This is a role for a thoughtful problem solver with an excellent service and troubleshooting mindset as well as strong communication, documentation and analytical skills.\n \nWhat does this job entail?\n \n Support customers through site visits, phone and email channels \n Manage support queue with urgency and professionalism \n Collect and organize customer statistics, issues, and ideas \n Provide feedback about issues in the field to internal product and quality teams \n Remotely monitor deployments and resolve issues \n Be an internal advocate for customers \n \nRequired\n \n B.S. in Electrical, Computer or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience \n Strong analytical skills \n Hands-on experience with troubleshooting equipment and/or machinery \n Ability to travel 25-50% of the time \n Passion for serving the customer \n \nWhy work for Canvas?\n \nWe are a robotics company changing the way materials are moved. We have a driving passion for creating ground-breaking products and a desire to have big impact. Our environment is exciting, challenging, collaborative, and fun...and we’re building game-changing products. You’ll work with a tight-knit and creative team on state-of-the art solutions to real problems.\n \nOur office is located in Boulder CO, in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains. Many of us commute by bike and you’ll be a short distance from some of the best hiking, climbing and skiing in the U.S. Boulder offers a unique mix of outdoors, fine dining, microbrewing and much more. Plus, it’s just a happy place.\n \nWe’re looking for motivated and passionate individuals who love to build things and solve problems. If this is you, please send us your resume and include a clear and concise cover letter to help us understand more about you, including why you are interested in Canvas, why you are leaving or have left your current position, and anything else that will give us a better sense of who you are and what you are looking for.\n \nWe are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, or other protected class.', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

type="submit">Find Jobs</button></div><div class="icl-WhatWhere-advSearchWrapper"><a class="icl-WhatWhere-advSearchLink" href="/advanced_search">Advanced Job Search</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></body></html><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-rowSpacingLine icl-u-lg-block icl-u-xs-hide"></div><div class="icl-Grid jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-content icl-u-lg-mt--md"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-innerContent icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-offset2 icl-u-lg-span10"><div class="icl-Grid"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-jobDisplay icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Robotics Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">Canvas Technology</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Boulder, CO 80301</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md">We have an immediate opening for an excellent Robotics engineer with hands-on experience. In this role you will work with a small team of sales representatives, service agents, electrical, mechanical, software and robotics engineers in a fast-moving environment where you will have direct impact on our success. You will be resolving a wide range of customer-facing challenges, including best-in-class customer use and deployment as well as in-field process improvements. This is a role for a thoughtful problem solver with an excellent service and troubleshooting mindset as well as strong communication, documentation and analytical skills.
<br/><br/>
What does this job entail?
<br/><ul>
<li>Support customers through site visits, phone and email channels</li>
<li>Manage support queue with urgency and professionalism</li>
<li>Collect and organize customer statistics, issues, and ideas</li>
<li>Provide feedback about issues in the field to internal product and quality teams</li>
<li>Remotely monitor deployments and resolve issues</li>
<li>Be an internal advocate for customers</li>
</ul>
Required
<br/><ul>
<li>B.S. in Electrical, Computer or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience</li>
<li>Strong analytical skills</li>
<li>Hands-on experience with troubleshooting equipment and/or machinery</li>
<li>Ability to travel 25-50% of the time</li>
<li>Passion for serving the customer</li>
</ul>
Why work for Canvas?
<br/><br/>
We are a robotics company changing the way materials are moved. We have a driving passion for creating ground-breaking products and a desire to have big impact. Our environment is exciting, challenging, collaborative, and fun...and we’re building game-changing products. You’ll work with a tight-knit and creative team on state-of-the art solutions to real problems.
<br/><br/>
Our office is located in Boulder CO, in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains. Many of us commute by bike and you’ll be a short distance from some of the best hiking, climbing and skiing in the U.S. Boulder offers a unique mix of outdoors, fine dining, microbrewing and much more. Plus, it’s just a happy place.
<br/><br/>
We’re looking for motivated and passionate individuals who love to build things and solve problems. If this is you, please send us your resume and include a clear and concise cover letter to help us understand more about you, including why you are interested in Canvas, why you are leaving or have left your current position, and anything else that will give us a better sense of who you are and what you are looking for.
<br/><br/>
We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, or other protected class.</div><div Be current in latest technology and trends concerning robotic applications; 7. Implement best practices and products for robot dress packs; 8. Adhere to Quality, Safety, and Environmental Policies; 9. Understand and follow all required GPS standards; 10. Participates in the creation and support of systems, documentation and actions to assure conformance to Quality Systems (TS) and Environmental Management Systems (ISO); 11. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x]. \nResponsibilities\n Anticipate the needs of your managers and team members while helping them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative challenges as they arise. \n Manage calendars and schedule meetings with multiple internal and external guests. Take detailed notes during these meetings. \n Respond to requests in timely fashion via phone, email and text messages. \n Work with professionalism and maintain confidentiality in all areas. \n Build relationships with vendors and maintain facilities management. \n Qualifications\n Minimum qualifications: \n BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. \n 2 years of experience working in an administration role. \n \nPreferred qualifications: \n Experience working in an administration capacity for tech start ups, or within the tech industry. \n Experience in planning off-site and other team events. \n Ability to learn new technical tools/systems. \n Excellent communications and attention to detail skills. \n \n At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><div><div><div>As an Administrative Business Partner, you'll work on a variety of administrative tasks such as; scheduling meetings, bookings, documentation and vendor/facility management.
<p>X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].</p></div><div><div><div>
Responsibilities
</div><div><ul><li>Anticipate the needs of your managers and team members while helping them stay focused on their projects by resolving operational and administrative challenges as they arise.</li>
<li>Manage calendars and schedule meetings with multiple internal and external guests. Take detailed notes during these meetings.</li>
<li>Respond to requests in timely fashion via phone, email and text messages.</li>
<li>Work with professionalism and maintain confidentiality in all areas.</li>
<li>Build relationships with vendors and maintain facilities management.</li>
</ul></div></div><div><div>Qualifications
</div><div>Minimum qualifications:<ul>
<li>BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.</li>
<li>2 years of experience working in an administration role.</li>
</ul><br/>
Preferred qualifications:<ul>
<li>Experience working in an administration capacity for tech start ups, or within the tech industry.</li>
<li>Experience in planning off-site and other team events.</li>
<li>Ability to learn new technical tools/systems.</li>
<li>Excellent communications and attention to detail skills.</li>
</ul></div></div></div></div><br/>
<div><div>At Google, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.</div></div><div><div><b>

['2018-2019 Campus Graduate - Information Research (R&D) - Robotics Developer ', 'Midland, TX ', 'The Dow Chemical Company', 'https://indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=46dea7c99d4f6cb6&fccid=5e232844f622d780&vjs=3', "The Dow Chemical Company's Research and Development (R&D), Formulation Science & Automation organization has exciting and challenging opportunities for full time hires for  new graduate Bachelor, Master or PhD candidates.  These positions are located in Midland, Michigan. \n \n The Formulation Science & Automation (FS&A) group provides information technology and information management-based solutions to drive value and accelerate discovery in the R&D organizations throughout Dow. Information Research is focused on making Dow Research and Development the best at using information technology for a competitive advantage. \n \n The Automation team is seeking a mechanical, chemical or electrical engineer for the development of custom laboratory robotic systems for use in diverse global applications in Core R&D. The candidate must possess good communication, teamwork skills, and a passion in learning and developing laboratory robotic-based applications. The candidate is expected to have software program and instrumentation skills listed below. Travel will be required to other Dow locations (~5%).", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><div>The Dow Chemical Company's Research and Development (R&amp;D), Formulation Science &amp; Automation organization has exciting and challenging opportunities for full time hires for <b>new graduate Bachelor, Master or PhD candidates. </b>These positions are located in Midland, Michigan.</div>
<br/>
<div>The Formulation Science &amp; Automation (FS&amp;A) group provides information technology and information management-based solutions to drive value and accelerate discovery in the R&amp;D organizations throughout Dow. Information Research is focused on making Dow Research and Development the best at using information technology for a competitive advantage.</div>
<br/>
<div>The Automation team is seeking a mechanical, chemical or electrical engineer for the development of custom laboratory robotic systems for use in diverse global applications in Core R&amp;D. The candidate must possess good communication, teamwork skills, and a passion in learning and developing laboratory robotic-based applications. The candidate is expected to have software program and instrumentation skills listed below. Travel will be required to other Dow locations (~5%).</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span ['Advanced Robotics R&D Engineer Intern Summer 2019 ', 'North Reading, MA ', 'Amazon.com', 'https://indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=995466533ceaa1c0&fccid=fe2d21eef233e94a&vjs=3', 'Job Description\n Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun. \n \nAmazon Robotics is seeking talented and motivated interns to conduct research, develop, and test software and hardware for next-generation robotic manipulation solutions used in Amazon.com fulfillment operations. The Advanced Robotics Organization develops robotic manipulation technologies including foundational research on planning, perception, and end-of-arm tools. Ideal candidates will be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program related to software engineering or robotics. This position will report to the Amazon Robotics functional manager most closely aligned with the candidate’s skillset and project work. Each intern will have an assigned technical mentor throughout the internship, as well as 1-1 guidance from their manager, and will work closely with other engineers. \n \nThe Intern will be responsible for: \n Identifying creative solutions for challenging research problems in robotics and computer vision \nDeveloping software solutions to test hypotheses and demonstrate new functionality \nPrototyping concepts to collect data and measure performance \nCreating milestones and deliverables and tracking status with team \nDeveloping design documentation and leading reviews with other interns and engineers \nWriting code and unit tests and integrating code with other software and hardware components \nUtilizing Amazon Robotics and Amazon engineering tools, processes and technologies \nDelivering a final presentation to managers and engineers on the successes and challenges of their internship and the business value they have contributed \n Basic Qualifications\n Completion of at least junior year of degree program is required \nDegree program in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, applied math or other algorithmic-centric discipline \nGPA of 3.3 or higher \nAbility to collaborate effectively with a diverse, talented team \nSense of humor and willingness to learn \n Preferred Qualifications\n Proficient oral and written communication skills \nExperience with creative problem solving and getting things done \nExperience with C++, Python, or Matlab \nExperience with ROS, OpenCV, or PCL', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

class="icl-NavigableContainer icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderBottom icl-NavigableContainer--hasBorderTop"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-innerContainer"><h4 class="jobsearch-CompanyReview--heading">Amazon.com</h4><div class="icl-Ratings icl-Ratings--gold icl-Ratings--md" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating"><meta content="3.5999999046325684" itemprop="ratingValue"><meta content="27499" itemprop="ratingCount"><div aria-label="3.6 out of 5" class="icl-Ratings-starsCountWrapper" tabindex="0"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsWrapper"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsUnfilled"><div class="icl-Ratings-starsFilled" style="width: 64.19999885559082px;"></div></div></div><div aria-hidden="true" class="icl-NavigableContainer-iconContainer"><div class="icl-NavigableContainer-icon icl-NavigableContainer-icon--isRightArrow"><svg class="icl-Icon icl-Icon--sm icl-Icon--left icl-Icon--black icl-u-xs-mt--md"><div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Job Description
</b></h2><div><div><div>Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.<br/>
<br/>
Amazon Robotics is seeking talented and motivated interns to conduct research, develop, and test software and hardware for next-generation robotic manipulation solutions used in Amazon.com fulfillment operations. The Advanced Robotics Organization develops robotic manipulation technologies including foundational research on planning, perception, and end-of-arm tools. Ideal candidates will be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program related to software engineering or robotics. This position will report to the Amazon Robotics functional manager most closely aligned with the candidate’s skillset and project work. Each intern will have an assigned technical mentor throughout the internship, as well as 1-1 guidance from their manager, and will work closely with other engineers.<br/>
<br/>
The Intern will be responsible for:<br/>
<ul><li>Identifying creative solutions for challenging research problems in robotics and computer vision</li><li>
Developing software solutions to test hypotheses and demonstrate new functionality</li><li>
Prototyping concepts to collect data and measure performance</li><li>
Creating milestones and deliverables and tracking status with team</li><li>
Developing design documentation and leading reviews with other interns and engineers</li><li>
Writing code and unit tests and integrating code with other software and hardware components</li><li>
Utilizing Amazon Robotics and Amazon engineering tools, processes and technologies</li><li>
Delivering a final presentation to managers and engineers on the successes and challenges of their internship and the business value they have contributed</li></ul>
</div></div></div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Basic Qualifications
</b></h2><div><div><div><ul><li>Completion of at least junior year of degree program is required</li><li>
Degree program in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, applied math or other algorithmic-centric discipline</li><li>
GPA of 3.3 or higher</li><li>
Ability to collaborate effectively with a diverse, talented team</li><li>
Sense of humor and willingness to learn</li></ul>
</div></div></div><h2 class="jobSectionHeader"><b>Preferred Qualifications
</b></h2><div><div><div><ul><li>Proficient oral and written communication skills</li><li>
Experience with creative problem solving and getting things done</li><li>
Experience with C++, Python, or Matlab</li><li>
Experience with ROS, OpenCV, or PCL</li></ul></div></div></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span ['Entry Level Manufacturing Engineer ', 'Wichita, KS 67205 ', 'Cox Machine', 'https://indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=9d759f9f4fbd6067&fccid=8a407ba2080a92e2&vjs=3', 'Send Resumes to: \nemail: jobs@coxmachine.com \nmail: Cox Machine, Inc. \n5338 W. 21st Street, Suite 100 \nWichita, KS 67205 \n Entry Level Manufacturing Engineer \nResponsible for developing and improving manufacturing processes by studying product and manufacturing methods. Develops solutions for problems related to the manufacturing of components or assemblies. Position acts as liaison between Programming, Manufacturing, and Management. Expected to develop and deploy a common manufacturing vision utilizing Lean Manufacturing tools. Responsible for supporting Estimating and Planning on new projects. Must have strong communication skills and the ability to communicate with all levels within the organization. Expected to lead a wide range of continuous improvement initiatives, including Kaizen events, 5S, and value stream mapping. Must have a working knowledge of customer engineering (drawings, parts lists, POS, special planning, etc.). Robotics experience and/or knowledge a plus.', <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

5338 W. 21st Street, Suite 100<br/>
Wichita, KS 67205</p>
<br/><div><p><b>Entry Level Manufacturing Engineer</b><br/>
Responsible for developing and improving manufacturing processes by studying product and manufacturing methods. Develops solutions for problems related to the manufacturing of components or assemblies. Position acts as liaison between Programming, Manufacturing, and Management. Expected to develop and deploy a common manufacturing vision utilizing Lean Manufacturing tools. Responsible for supporting Estimating and Planning on new projects. Must have strong communication skills and the ability to communicate with all levels within the organization. Expected to lead a wide range of continuous improvement initiatives, including Kaizen events, 5S, and value stream mapping. Must have a working knowledge of customer engineering (drawings, parts lists, POS, special planning, etc.). Robotics experience and/or knowledge a plus.</p></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span class="icl-u-textColor--success">Cox ['Robotics Engineer ', 'Raleigh, NC ', 'Formlabs', 'https://indeed.com/rc/clk?jk=4756a36f795cf6c5&fccid=8e0192a48bd27a99&vjs=3', "If you're looking to apply your robotics knowledge to challenging problems that will stretch your ability to engineer and design complex systems, join Formlabs as a Robotics Engineer. We're working to reinvent additive manufacturing and enable designers, engineers, researchers, health practitioners and artists all around the world.\n \nAt Formlabs, you can apply an interdisciplinary approach to solving technically hard problems. Inexpensive sensors, thoughtful software, and clever mechanical design allow us to build 3D printers that are much more capable and accessible than what has been possible before. Sit at the intersection of many engineering disciplines to make our 3D printers work seamlessly.\n \nUse your experience and skills at making complex systems work to research, develop, design and ship 3D printers. You will write software for precise motion control and sensor readings, making sound design decisions about mechanisms and software to allow Formlabs to move quickly and develop systems faster.\n \n \n A portfolio/website is strongly encouraged for this role \n \n The Job: \n \n Engineer electro-mechanical systems for 3D printers \n Write software, build electronics, and design mechanisms \n Work at the intersection of many disciplines to make complicated systems function smoothly \n \n You: \n \n 3+ years of industry experience \n Experience working on multi-disciplinary engineering products \n Experience working with sensors, motors and other electro-mechanical systems \n Fluent in mechanical design, electrical systems and software \n Experience using Python or a similar language to analyze data and control electro-mechanical systems \n \n Our Perks: \n \n Flexible Vacation \n Generous premium coverage for medical, dental, and vision plans \n Paid parental leave \n Commuter benefits \n Unlimited 3D prints \n Please note this position is based out of our North Carolina office. \n \nWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

Search</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></body></html><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-rowSpacingLine icl-u-lg-block icl-u-xs-hide"></div><div class="icl-Grid jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-content icl-u-lg-mt--md"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-innerContent icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-offset2 icl-u-lg-span10"><div class="icl-Grid"><div class="jobsearch-ViewJobLayout-jobDisplay icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Robotics Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">Formlabs</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Raleigh, NC</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md">If you're looking to apply your robotics knowledge to challenging problems that will stretch your ability to engineer and design complex systems, join Formlabs as a Robotics Engineer. We're working to reinvent additive manufacturing and enable designers, engineers, researchers, health practitioners and artists all around the world.
<br/><br/>
At Formlabs, you can apply an interdisciplinary approach to solving technically hard problems. Inexpensive sensors, thoughtful software, and clever mechanical design allow us to build 3D printers that are much more capable and accessible than what has been possible before. Sit at the intersection of many engineering disciplines to make our 3D printers work seamlessly.
<br/><br/>
Use your experience and skills at making complex systems work to research, develop, design and ship 3D printers. You will write software for precise motion control and sensor readings, making sound design decisions about mechanisms and software to allow Formlabs to move quickly and develop systems faster.
<br/><br/>
<ul>
<li>A portfolio/website is strongly encouraged for this role</li>
</ul>
<b>The Job:</b><br/>
<ul>
<li>Engineer electro-mechanical systems for 3D printers</li>
<li>Write software, build electronics, and design mechanisms</li>
<li>Work at the intersection of many disciplines to make complicated systems function smoothly</li>
</ul>
<b>You:</b><br/>
<ul>
<li>3+ years of industry experience</li>
<li>Experience working on multi-disciplinary engineering products</li>
<li>Experience working with sensors, motors and other electro-mechanical systems</li>
<li>Fluent in mechanical design, electrical systems and software</li>
<li>Experience using Python or a similar language to analyze data and control electro-mechanical systems</li>
</ul>
<b>Our Perks:</b><br/>
<ul>
<li>Flexible Vacation</li>
<li>Generous premium coverage for medical, dental, and vision plans</li>
<li>Paid parental leave</li>
<li>Commuter benefits</li>
<li>Unlimited 3D prints</li>
<li>Please note this position is based out of our North Carolina office.</li>
</ul>
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.</div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter"><span ['Automation & Robotics Electrical Engineer ', 'Greensboro, NC ', 'ABCO Automation Inc.', 'https://indeed.com/pagead/clk?mo=r&ad=-6NYlbfkN0ByWq4Q7BKU9eeRNUNgTI2T-ZRDyXNLUCPKPaHHse5OAGnhDrZk8ec8gcF_v5t8nSZveuQAptXOJYWshFJj93GOx3Jl7Zn8XyogZrewSR67ktmfAjIx-nw1pr1lwRfq2I9a5qTsKpQuFZVQBZi63kUC9u_LIH3jcQGCoenMecvZvTkHg3Tm3NRbaB97vzByESMTB3cvj_dOaa_6ZKA3OjdotMOskS1bnrnNl5DPGtdw-BtT9jrnwOw7OwB_nMLn2umMbC9IL0xfMQeKWULbUwTorOXDJjNrCEssCpnEywsBVmJWK90QW-M56HkJA-BjH4hzaCip1cpeaxOrH4UHiLajEUvwgtT80EDZitMngGktleF452MCG_MW8jeDU9hC-rk7kwaKRNhOrf9qNcHMAmSK5y78xH3fZmkAS0pBvPCvfg==&vjs=3&p=6&sk=&fvj=1', "This is ABCO! We’re leading the charge, growing our brand, our people and the engineering services we offer the world. We are creating automation plans for the future – and continue to refine where and how we serve our customers, and what it takes to win. ABCO is an employee owned company and our diverse team comes from all backgrounds, nationalities and walks of life. Our shared values and passion make us  one winning team. Whatever your specialty, you’ll find multiple opportunities to grow with ABCO. Job Summary:  Provides electrical design, project management and technical expertise on small to medium-sized projects involving multidisciplinary project teams with minimum supervision. Major Accountabilities:  Designs and implements control systems in-line with project budgets, schedules and customer requirements seeking assistance as required from senior electrical engineers. Project design and implementation include material specification and procurement, schematics, layouts, programming, setup, testing and debugging, installation and startup. Maintains a wide range of expertise in PLC, HMI, robotics, motion and vision systems. Participates in the approval of control system design and documentation with regard to meeting established quality, performance and safety requirements. Involved in the approval of customer acceptance and experimental test Meets or exceeds margins by effectively planning and executing assigned project work. Develops applications for PLC, HMI, process, motion, vision and robotic systems as well as reviews system requirements and functional specifications. Maintains positive vendor relations in order to readily receive assistance on future projects. Maintains positive customer relations in order to increase the probability of repeat business. Demonstrates technical competence in a variety of technologies. Utilizes all ABCO systems and procedures effectively, including Syteline, to manage work in an accurately and timely manner. Demonstrates the ability to lead another engineer and/or designer on medium-sized projects. Provides guidance to less experienced engineers and designers. Presents a neat and professional appearance. Exhibits a positive and proactive attitude. Displays approachability and flexibility as a strong team player. Demonstrates dependable attendance. Working Conditions:  Working environment is generally favorable with adequate lighting and temperature. There are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, smells, etc. Conditions at customer sites may vary from excellent to very poor. Aproximately 15% travel required. Minimum Education Required:  Bachelor Degree in Engineering (BSEE) or equivalent experience. Minimum Years of Experience Required:  Three (3+) years of electrical engineering project management and design. Key Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required:  Programming Skills – Robotic, motion, vision PLC, HMI software Decision Making Analytical Thinking Detail-Oriented Interpersonal and Written Communication Skills PC Skills - MS Office Project Management Technical Functional Knowledge – Control Systems, Packaging, Assembly & Process Machinery Industry Product Knowledge Problem Solving Job Type: Full-time Experience: Controls Engineer: 3 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Location: Greensboro, NC (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required) Required travel: 25% (Preferred)", <html dir="ltr" lang="en">

icl-Grid-col icl-u-xs-span12 icl-u-lg-span7"><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent icl-u-xs-mt--sm"><div class="jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer"><h3 class="icl-u-xs-mb--xs icl-u-xs-mt--none jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-title">Automation &amp; Robotics Electrical Engineer</h3><div class="icl-u-xs-mt--xs icl-u-textColor--secondary jobsearch-JobInfoHeader-subtitle jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-subtitle"><div class="jobsearch-InlineCompanyRating icl-u-xs-mt--xs jobsearch-DesktopStickyContainer-companyrating"><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">ABCO Automation Inc.</div><div class="icl-u-lg-mr--sm icl-u-xs-mr--xs">-</div><div>Greensboro, NC</div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider"><div class="jobsearch-StickyContainerDivider-line"></div></div></div><div class="jobsearch-JobComponent-description icl-u-xs-mt--md"><p>This is ABCO!</p><p>We’re leading the charge, growing our brand, our people and the engineering services we offer the world. We are creating automation plans for the future – and continue to refine where and how we serve our customers, and what it takes to win.</p><p>ABCO is an employee owned company and our diverse team comes from all backgrounds, nationalities and walks of life. Our shared values and passion make us <i>one</i>winning team. Whatever your specialty, you’ll find multiple opportunities to grow with ABCO.</p><p><b>Job Summary: </b></p><p>Provides electrical design, project management and technical expertise on small to medium-sized projects involving multidisciplinary project teams with minimum supervision.</p><p><b>Major Accountabilities: </b></p><ul><li>Designs and implements control systems in-line with project budgets, schedules and customer requirements seeking assistance as required from senior electrical engineers. Project design and implementation include material specification and procurement, schematics, layouts, programming, setup, testing and debugging, installation and startup. Maintains a wide range of expertise in PLC, HMI, robotics, motion and vision systems.</li><li>Participates in the approval of control system design and documentation with regard to meeting established quality, performance and safety requirements. Involved in the approval of customer acceptance and experimental test</li><li>Meets or exceeds margins by effectively planning and executing assigned project work. Develops applications for PLC, HMI, process, motion, vision and robotic systems as well as reviews system requirements and functional specifications.</li><li>Maintains positive vendor relations in order to readily receive assistance on future projects.</li><li>Maintains positive customer relations in order to increase the probability of repeat business.</li><li>Demonstrates technical competence in a variety of technologies.</li><li>Utilizes all ABCO systems and procedures effectively, including Syteline, to manage work in an accurately and timely manner.</li><li>Demonstrates the ability to lead another engineer and/or designer on medium-sized projects. Provides guidance to less experienced engineers and designers.</li><li>Presents a neat and professional appearance.</li><li>Exhibits a positive and proactive attitude.</li><li>Displays approachability and flexibility as a strong team player.</li><li>Demonstrates dependable attendance.</li></ul><p><b>Working Conditions: </b></p><p>Working environment is generally favorable with adequate lighting and temperature. There are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, smells, etc. Conditions at customer sites may vary from excellent to very poor. Aproximately 15% travel required.</p><p><b>Minimum Education Required: </b></p><p>Bachelor Degree in Engineering (BSEE) or equivalent experience.</p><p><b>Minimum Years of Experience Required: </b></p><p>Three (3+) years of electrical engineering project management and design.</p><p><b>Key Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required: </b></p><ul><li>Programming Skills – Robotic, motion, vision PLC, HMI software</li><li>Decision Making</li><li>Analytical Thinking</li><li>Detail-Oriented</li><li>Interpersonal and Written Communication Skills</li><li>PC Skills - MS Office</li><li>Project Management</li><li>Technical Functional Knowledge – Control Systems, Packaging, Assembly &amp; Process Machinery</li><li>Industry Product Knowledge</li><li>Problem Solving</li></ul><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Experience:</p><ul><li>Controls Engineer: 3 years (Required)</li></ul><p>Education:</p><ul><li>Bachelor's (Preferred)</li></ul><p>Location:</p><ul><li>Greensboro, NC (Preferred)</li></ul><p>Work authorization:</p><ul><li>United States (Required)</li></ul><p>Required travel:</p><ul><li>25% (Preferred)</li></ul></div><div class="jobsearch-JobDescriptionTab-content"><div class="jobsearch-JobMetadataFooter">2 days ago<span class="icl-u-lg-inline icl-u-xs-hide" id="saveJobInlineCallout"> -
